Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging

Interface Broadcaster

All Superinterfaces:
MessageTransceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Nameable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Receiver, Transceiver, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmitter
All Known Subinterfaces:
CheckTrait, GlobalRepeater, LanguageTrait, Repeater, RepeaterMixin, ResultTrait, TryTrait, UncheckedCode<Value>, UncheckedVoidCode
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseKivaKitProject, BaseMap, BaseRepeater, BaseStringMap, Batcher, BroadcastingProgressReporter, CacheMap, ConcurrentBroadcastingProgressReporter, ConcurrentObjectMap, CountMap, JavaVirtualMachine, KivaKit, KivaKitThread, LinkedMap, MessageChecker, Multicaster, MultiMap, MultiSet, ObjectMap, Project, RepeatingThread, Result, Retry, StateMachine, StringMap, VariableMap
public interface Broadcaster extends MessageTransceiver
Broadcasts a message to zero or more listeners via transmit(Transmittable). Listeners can be added with addListener(Listener) and can be cleared with clearListeners(). A number of convenience methods in the Transceiver superclass make it easier to broadcast specific messages.

Convenience Methods

A number of convenience methods in the Transceiver superinterface make it easy to transmit specific common messages. Repeaters are Broadcasters (as well as Listeners) which inherit the methods in this class as well as those in Transceiver. For details on how to take advantage of this in object design, see Repeater.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

  • Method Details

    • addListener

      void addListener(Listener listener, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.comparison.Filter<com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.messaging.Transmittable> filter)
      Adds a listener to this broadcaster that wants to receive future messages. This is the mirror method of Listener.listenTo(Broadcaster) as both methods achieve the same thing.

      Note: adding the same listener two or more times will not replace the original listener. To do that, call clearListeners() before calling this method

      Parameters:
      listener - Listener to broadcast to. Implementations should ignore null listeners.
      filter - The filter to apply

    • addListener

      default void addListener(Listener listener)
      Adds a listener to this broadcaster that wants to receive future messages.

      Note: adding the same listener two or more times will not replace the original listener. To do that, call clearListeners() before calling this method
